6500.name: The Path to the Dwarven Village
6500.description:
You walk in the hill's shadow down an ever-widening path which leads to the
outskirts of the dwarven village.  The hill rises above you to the southwest,
and a smaller path leads to its crest in that direction.  A tunnel here leads
down a short distance into the hill itself, and the dwarven village can be
seen near the mountains to the north.

6501.name: Path nearing the Mountain
6501.description:
You are near the base a rugged mountain.  Dense forest prevents passage in
most directions, and it grows dark to the north as the path begins its way
up the shadowed mountain.

6502.name: Path up the Mountain
6502.description:
Standing near the halfway point up the mountain, you can easily see the
hill of the crossroads in the distance to the southwest, while the top
of the mountain is very near to the north.

6503.name: Top of the Mountain
6503.description:
You stand on the mountain's top.  Far to the south you can see the spires
of the city of Darkhaven, and a path leads down the mountainside to its
base in that direction.  To your east and west, large gates have been
built into the rock face.

6504.name: Along the Narrow Path
6504.description:
This is a narrow, eerie path leading to the far side of the dwarven village.
It looks to be less travelled than the others, and continues to north or
opens up to the south.

6505.name: A Gate in the Mountain
6505.description:
You stand in before a large tunnel which leads into the mountain.  Barring
access to the tunnel is a large, sturdy gate painted a dark green and
secured with an oversized lock.

6506.name: Bend in the Narrow Path
6506.description:
The path narrows and bends here to the east.  The increasing trees hang over
the path, which itself is becoming rapidly overgrown.  The path continues to
the south and east.

exdescs.tree: They hang over the road in the most ominous of ways.
exdescs.trees: They hang over the road in the most ominous of ways.

6507.name: Bend in the Narrow Path
6507.description:
The path continues to narrow, and bends here to the north or back west.
The increasing trees hang over the path, which itself is overgrown.
The path continues to the north and west.

6508.name: Along the Narrow North-South Pass
6508.description:
The narrow path leads to both the north and south here.  To the north
and east you can see a tall structure, and to the narrow path leads
back along the mountain to the south.

6509.name: The Door to the Kingdom
6509.description:
The narrow path comes to an abrupt halt here.  A small castle of sorts
stands immediately to the east, and a guard post is just to the west.
The narrow path continues back over the mountain to the south.

6510.name: Path to the Castle
6510.description:
You are on a path that will eventually lead to the castle.  It
continues north to the castle, and there is a door on the western wall.

6511.name: Still on the path to the Castle
6511.description:
You are still on the path to the castle, or back to the
Dwarven village, whichever way you wish to go.  The path
continues to the north and south.

6512.name: Door to Castle
6512.description:
Here there is a door to the castle to the east.  The castle
is elegantly designed, and looks much like a roll of toilet paper
standing on end.  A sign says:

              ******************************************
              *  WELCOME TO THE CASTLE OF STRANGELOVE  *
              *      Here, celibacy is uninvited       *
              ******************************************

6513.name: Inside the entrance
6513.description:
Everything here is covered in soot and very grimy.  The path continues
to the east and north, and there is a door to the west.

6514.name: Path
6514.description:
You are on a path in the dwarven village which leads north to the shops
and south to the corner of the area.

6515.name: Turn in road
6515.description:
You are on a path that leads to a Hide & Tooth shop to the west, and the
path continues to the south.

6516.name: Hide & Tooth Shop
6516.description:
You are in the Hide & Tooth shop.  Here you may buy the finest in Dwarven
weapons and armors. The path continues to the north and east.

6517.name: Path to the north of shop
6517.description:
You are on a path to the north of the Hide & Tooth shop.  The path continues
to the north, and there is Granite Head's bakery to the west.

6518.name: North of Shops
6518.description:
Here the path bends to the east towards the barracks. To the
south you can see the shops.

6519.name: Path by Hospital
6519.description:
Here the path passes by the Hospital to the north.  It continues
to the east to the barracks, and to the west.

6520.name: Path next to barracks
6520.description: Here the path continues west, and east to the barracks.

6521.name: Entrance to barracks
6521.description:
Here there is an entrance to the barracks to the south, and
the path continues to the west.

6522.name: A Guard House
6522.description:
You stand inside a guard house just to the west of the castle's entrance.
There is little of interest here.

6523.name: First Barrack room
6523.description:
Here is the first of two main rooms of barracks.  The
barracks continue to the south, and you can leave the room
to the north.

6524.name: Back of Barracks
6524.description:
Here is the back of the dwarven barracks.  There are rows
of beds here, and there is a stench that is unbearable.

6525.name: Inside of Castle Strangelove
6525.description:
You are just inside the castle.  It is very tubular in shape,
and it is very featureless.  There is a set of stairs that lead
up, and the door leads out of the castle to the west.

6526.name: A store room
6526.description:
There is a layer of dust on the floor at least 3 inches thick!  It is
probable that not many people have been in here for many months.

exdescs.dust: After blowing all the dust off the floor, you notice a trapdoor!
exdescs.floor: After blowing all the dust off the floor, you notice a trapdoor!

6527.name: Wine cellar
6527.description:
This room smells like wine, and you can only assume it used to be
a wine cellar at one time.

6528.name: Stairs in castle
6528.description: The stairs continue to circle up and down here.

6529.name: Stairs
6529.description:
You are still circling around on the stairs.  You are starting to
get dizzy from going around and around and around and around and
around.  The stairs continue up and down.

6530.name: Top of stairs
6530.description:
You are at the top of the stairs in the castle.  There is an exit
to the east, and the stairs lead down.

6531.name: Queen's waiting room
6531.description:
This is the Queen's waiting room.  Here the men literally
'wait' for the queen.  You've heard that the queen really likes
to get to 'know' her people, in the biblical sense.  The queen's
bedroom is to the north, and you can see stairs to the west.

6532.name: Bedroom
6532.description:
This is the Queen's bedroom.  The bed is all ruffled, and there
is a stack of dirty sheets piled in the corner.

A note has been scrawled in lipstick on the mirror:

     I'm out looking for my pills.
     Why don't you slip into something comfortable while you're waiting?

6534.name: Hospital
6534.description:
You are inside the Dwarven Hospital.  It smells like rubbing
alcohol, and there is blood all over the walls.

6535.name: Granite Head's Bakery
6535.description:
The aroma coming from this room is sensuous.  You can almost taste
the pastries dissolving in your mouth.

6540.name: Dark Path before a Mountain Gate
6540.description:
Here, where the well worn path passes through shadow, stands a gate which
covers a wide tunnel leading into the mountainside.  Sounds and smells of
mining float up from the tunnel and through the bars.  The path continues
to the north and west, or you can take your chances through the gate.

6541.name: Mine entrance
6541.description:
The little path here leads down toward the mines, while the worn path
continues to the west.

6542.name: Inside the mine
6542.description:
There are holes everywhere from the places that the workers blew
away the rock to get to whatever they were looking for.  A path leads
down and up.

6543.name: Path in the mine
6543.description:
You are deep inside the mine, and you feel very uncomfortable.  The
path continues to the east, and leads to the mineshaft to the west.

6544.name: Mine crossroad
6544.description:
You are at a crossroad in the mine.  There is a door to the north,
and the path continues to the south, east, and west.

6545.name: Coal Room
6545.description:
You are inside the storage area for the raw materials
that are found down here.  The room is very unsturdy as the
supports are very rickety.

6546.name: Mine Maze
6546.description:
You have entered the maze of the mines.  To the east you
can see some inscriptions, and you can exit to the south.

6547.name: Maze inscription
6547.description: You are inside the maze, but not far enough in that you could get lost.

6551.name: Mining equipment room
6551.description:
This is the storage room for equipment used by the
Dwarven miners.  It is very small, and you can tell that
not many miners actually use any equipment.

6552.name: Solved the Maze.
6552.description:
You have solved the maze.  You can tell by the last few moves that there
is no way that a dumb worker could have figured that out.  It seems pretty
desolate here.
There is a sign along the south wall:

    Those who enter, plan on a timely death.
    Especially if you're loyal to the queen.

6553.name: The Mazekeeper's Room
6553.description:
You have entered the Mazekeeper's room.  There are pictures of
the Queen with darts thrown in it.  Spray-painted on the wall are
things like 'the queen shall suffer' and 'Catholics Rule'.

6554.name: Bottom of mineshaft
6554.description:
You are at the bottom of the mineshaft.  The air here is very sooty, and
it is very hard to breathe.  The mineshaft leads up and east.
